Amazing lens and low-light capabilities, tricks and features galore, 1080P video (as good as a not-too-old camcorder, if not better), GPS / geotagging, touch screen, long battery life - and more. And it slips into your shirt pocket. No disappointments here.

Reviews.Title: DMC- ZS10  14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: I have taken around 1500 photos in the past month with this camera and am very happy. I am a camera person. I take a lot of action pictures and as many indoor pictures both still and party type. The camers ability to adjust for lighting changes is very good. The telephoto lens is excellent. Several of my friends have made comments about how much better the overall quality of my pictures are compared to theirs useing simillar type camers. I would recommend this camera to anyone even if they only use it occasionly.

Reviews.Title: unstable performance and unacceptable low-light image quality
Reviews.Author: econiche
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the great features but eventually I am frustrated with low quality on low-light settings such as the sunset and indoor scenes that I like to photograph.  The zoom in function with focus is not always accurate and frustrating to use.  Most images look ok on the screen but I am a picky person on image quality and I can't stand the image noise that is so noticeable!  So I had to return it and get cannon which has better image quality.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS10
Reviews.Author: Fury
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of doing the shopping for the group present from the whole family for my brother's birthday.  I ended up picking this camera as he was looking for a small camera with a good zoom that is easy to carry around in his pocket and be able to take good quality pictures.  He has a brand new Canon DSLR, but that is not always functional to use for day to day pictures.  I gave it to him a week or so ago and we played around with it taking lots of pictures.  Overall we were both very pleased at the quality of the pictures.  The zoom is great for a small camera, and the camera is small enough it easily stores in a pocket for taking pictures on the go.  When we opened it up we found out that it takes 3d pictures (I didn't know about the feature when I bought it).  It basically takes a lot of pictures in a row while you move the camera, then stitches them together to make a virtual 3d image.  We did not have a 3d tv around to test the images, as I am the only one in the family with a 3d tv and we were not at my house, so I cannot comment on the quality of the 3d and how much of an effect it really gives the pictures.  As this is not something I even knew the camera had, it is more of a bonus and may or may not be used.  The reason I decided on this model over lower models was for the better quality touch screen on the back.  Overall, I am very pleased, but even more important than that, my brother is very pleased and he is looking forward to getting a lot of use on it on his upcoming vacation.

Reviews.Title: Downhill evolution
Reviews.Author: jgmookie
Reviews.Content: I had a DMC-ZS3.  Loved it!  It was the best, high quality image and versatile HD Video video (pocket) camera I ever had.  Then someone stole it.  I finally purchased another; I had no intentions of leaving Panasonic, as I was so pleased with the last one.  I bought the ZS10.  And have been exceedingly disappointed.  Indoors, low light, the camera is awful.  I have experimented with multiple modes, different flash modes, exposure, etc.  All from my experience with my ZS3.  The red-eye mode for crying out loud doesn't even work!  Every picture of my daughter, flash forced on or red-eye mode on, results in red-eye.  Even when the picture is taken during the day!!!  Ridiculous.The other huge let-down is the time for the camera to actually take a picture once you hit the button, or hold for focus, is extremely delayed compared to the older model.  I am talking about 2-4 Seconds...you miss your shot every single time.  Every time.  Talk about a step back.  I am disgusted with the sluggishness of this camera when operating.The ZS3 was quick, more instant, much better quality for stills of people, more versatile in different light conditions, particularly indoors.  The ZS10 might have added improvements to some environments, but I have not seen them in the day to day pictures I take.I am no photographer.  But that is why I loved the ZS3!  It produced excellent results without needing to be a photo-genius. The ZS10; poor.I have a problem when "evolution" and "advancement" leaves behind some basic functions and capabilities that were just fine they way they were.  Add ONTO, but don't cut out what was already effective and replace with other features.  Shame on Panasonic for their ZS10.I am not at all happy with this camera and would replace it in a heartbeat for the one I had.

Reviews.Title: Awful picture quality
Reviews.Author: Alex34
Reviews.Content: This camera has nice features like GPS, 3D, and full HD. However, it stops short of covering the basics - ability to make decent pictures. When shooting inside of the building where there is only lamp light, the picture quality is awful (noisy, unfocused) both in photo and video modes. I did not believe previous reviews on this issue and decided to rely on the legendary Lumix/Leika reputation and also to play with the camera options. Alas, this new Lumix DMC-ZS10 is a bummer.

Reviews.Title: I was going to return this camera...
Reviews.Author: S. C. Lykins "range rider"
Reviews.Content: I read all the pro and con reviews before buying the Lumix ZS10 but decided to try it out anyway, thinking all the while that I would probably return it, given the number of critical reviews regarding its image quality.  I have been a pro shooter for years, with a stable of cameras that included Nikon D3, D300 and D80 and I always had a Lumix camera as my sidekick when engaging in something that wasn't conducive to lugging around all that bulk and weight, such as horseback riding.I received my cute little ZS10 and handled it with kid gloves so that it would be in tip top returnable shape. I felt right at home with it because I've owned other Panasonics and was familiar with the menu controls.  I was a little obsessive about seeing just how intolerable the image quality was, being that was the big letdown according to enough other critics to make me wary.  It turned out to be true, that the images are softer than one would like. My last Panasonic was the FZ28, which produces a very respectable detailed image but was just too bulky for my grab and run fun shooter. Unfortunately, it got banged up pretty good. I scoured over the current offerings for weeks, reading review after review and almost pushed the button on several different models but there was always something wrong with them... it's as if the manufacturers conspire to not give us the perfect little point and shoot on purpose, each deciding which flaw to have so that nobody can have the perfect one. If it has great image quality then it might not have a great zoom or be lacking in stereo sound or have an annoying flash that pops up in the wrong location or myriad other annoyances.This little ZS10 has been in my hands for 2 weeks now and it has really grown on me. I know one should not like a camera for how it looks but for how it performs, but I do love the looks  and the feel of it. And I've found that using some of the many scene modes gives me very good results that I was not getting in the intelligent auto shooting mode.  As each day goes by I feel stronger that I'm going to keep it.  There are a ton of reviews that list all the pluses and minuses about this camera and I'm not one of those reviewers. All I'm going to say is that it performs decently, looks adorable (I got the brown model being an earthy tone girl turned off by blues and reds and bored by blacks and silvers) feels comfy in my hands and I'm quite satisfied with its image and video shooting because I have no illusions that it will double as a DSLR.  But it's no worse than my nephew's pocket size Nikon and has several more features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera--second one of these for my family
Reviews.Author: Griff
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures.  When I went to buy a second one of these ZS10s, the ZS 20s were already out.  I figured with the newer year model on the market the older ones would drop in price--they did, about $10.  That suggests hefty demand. I bought a newer ZS20 as well for about I paid for this one, but now the ZS20s have increased in price by a full 50% of the original price at which they were introduced.  Would I pay that inflated price for one? No--it's a point and shoot with good quality and lots of options, but getting to that price you can start to look at a digital SLR.

Reviews.Title: Does It All
Reviews.Author: DiveDoggie
Reviews.Content: This camera does it all.  The SCN menu allows you to adjust your camera quickly to get the right setting for great pictures - even for the camera illiterate.  Night time, macro, distance, it's an excellent balance of all of the above.  The video quality is also very nice and better than expected for a "point and shoot" camera.  Great to travel with and a definite must for the photography enthusiast who cannot pack the giant SLR.  There are enough options to keep the avid photographer busy and yet simple enough for a kid to figure out.  The camera is relatively tough, but avoid fine sand and any hard knocks.  This camera is not suitable for beach, wind or banging around, but the LUMIX DMC-TS3 or TS4 is if you're looking for something that balances this camera with a "tougher" user.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera but problems with GPS laws
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Mt. Everest Base Camp. I wanted the GPS to track my photo locations, unfortunately GPS is not allowed in the Himalayas of Nepal, the camera reported "GPS function not allowed in this region". I did get the GPS to work sometimes when I was in Kathmandu, however I should have tried getting a location before I went site seeing as it took a long time to finally get a position. I had a layover in Hong Kong and the GPS worked flawlessly there when I was outside, it couldn't get a location when I set it by the window in my hotel room. The photos look great, even the ones taken through the airplane windows. In "intelligent auto" mode I did run into problems with the auto-focus finding the closest thing and focusing on that, it was a problem when trying to take photos of the mountains through gaps in tree branches, if there was one leaf or twig in the the frame the camera would usually focus on it. Using other modes you can force a focus location which is nice but you need to know how to set the other settings as well. Battery life is very good when not using GPS or flash, GPS kills the battery very quickly though, make sure you have spares and a charger with you if you plan on using the GPS while traveling.My previous cameras are from Olympus, Kodak and Canon. For general shooting the Canon takes better photos, has very good manual controls, but it is old, lacks HDR and is very bulky for its 5x zoom, the Kodak is the worst camera I've ever owned, it is very compact but I have had photos disappear from the memory cards before transferring to my computer and the image quality is very poor, the Olympus has slightly more zoom than this camera but is very bulky, almost compact SLR size, lacks GPS, HDR and long exposure. Of all the cameras I own, this will be my go to camera unless I need slightly more zoom or more manual control without zooming.

Reviews.Title: Best Cam I've Ever Used [film or digital]
Reviews.Author: Dan T. L.
Reviews.Content: I could spend four times as much for a DSLR and then spring for alternate lenses but I am very happy with this 16 X zoom with multiple operating modes.  It has "Scene Modes", portrait, soft skin, scenery/landscape, panorama assist, sports [stop action shooting], night portrait, night scenery, handheld night shot, food, party [indoor light source adjustment], candle light, sunset, high sensitivity [adjusts ASA to reduce blurriness indoors], aerial [shooting thru windows], snow, beach, fireworks, starry sky [extremely dark subjects], flash burst, pin hole [mimics old pinhole camera photos], film grain, high dynamic, high speed movie, etc.  It also has the typical Automatic, Programmed, Aperture priority, Shutter priority, Manual, Custom [three pre-sets], 3D mode, macro [two types], HD movies with stereo sound, etc.  16x zoom lens, auto focus [several modes], GPS data available and it comes in a nice sized package, lightweight and easily carried [I wear it on my belt everyday at work] and decent battery life.I used film 135mm SLR cameras for forty years and this camera makes their results look bad.  That is not an exaggeration!  My favorite camera so far.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera. GPS must be improved
Reviews.Author: cfuruno
Reviews.Content: The quality of this camera is unprecedented.Leica lenses still one of betters in the market.Camera are very use to use, with easy controls.I think that Panasonic could do some videos to teach how use all modes of camera, instead of put it on a manual for download.I recommend buy SD Card class 10 to record videos in Full HD and HD mode.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and always handy in my purse!
Reviews.Author: H. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I simply love this Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS10 camera.  It takes super pictures which allow for great enlargements and I can carry it in my purse, so it's always available when I run into the perfect shot.  Now I don't have to carry my "big" telephoto lens on my Canon to get quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Salnu "Sal"
Reviews.Content: This is my third camera. I use to own a Sony but it died in a year and a half. Then I bought an Olympus but flash pictures were horribly grainy. This Panasonic Lumix is awesome. Great pics and videos. No real flaws to speak of yet.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic ZS10
Reviews.Author: birddog
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a canoe trip in Canada. The automatic setting worked great for both still shots & movies.The camera was easy to use, the battery lasted 6 days, taking 200 pictures & about 8 movies ranging from 40 seconds to 2 minutes.Start up time was a bit slow,that would be my only criticism.

Reviews.Title: fullfilled my expectations
Reviews.Author: Dr. Marko Rocznik
Reviews.Content: I loved the FinePix F30 and tried to replace (and upgrade) it. The ZS10 is a great camera and almost fullfilled all my expectations. From other review I learned already that under pore light condition the F30 would still be better - and it's true - the ZS10 can't compete with the F30 in low light without Flash.As for the rest I'm simply blown away! The super zoom combined with the image stabilization is something I have never seen before. I really love this and also the overall handling of the camera. One Example is for instance that there are two push buttons: one for taking a picture and one for making video. No fidelling around with menues or dial switches - just push and the thing starts.I'm very happy with my decition, especially because I had to return a Canon camera which has very similar specs but poor picture quality.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA HAS A MIND OF ITS OWN
Reviews.Author: Carol Underwood "NANNY"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the PANASONIC DMC-ZS10 camera almost a year ago because of the better zoom than on all the other Lumix models I have owned. I have had nothing but problems with it. It will start bursting pictures in the middle of taking regular shots. Quality of Pictures is not as good as the previous 4 Lumix models I have owned. Sometimes it takes several seconds for the picture to take and by that time the moment is lost. I am very frustrated by this camera.The fill light is awful. Pictures come out dark or blurry. I would like to see if the DMC-ZS20 is better since the reviews I have read say it is. I have been a loyal buyer of the Lumix cameras because of the compact size and the great zoom but maybe I should look at the Canon which has the 20x zoom also.

Reviews.Title: A pleasant surprise
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Merchandiser when working, m...
Reviews.Content: This is my second Panasonic camera.The first one got stolen, hopefully the person has found that one useful.Bought this one after extended research.Found it very versatile, still many features I haven't been used so far.Does really good in the macro mode and very nice to be able to lock the focal point.I haven't used the GPS function, doesn't really need it but maybe some day when my memory starts to fail or on longer trips.The lens (Leica) is very sharp, even out in the corners.For a 200 dollar camera I would definitely buy it again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Emilie28
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my camera. We had the SZ-7 and this newer version, SZ-10, is great. Takes very nice and clear pictures in low light and without flash, the overall quality of the pictures is a great as with the SZ-7, and I discovered that this SZ-10 version has a touch screen to take pictures, zoom, go through the pictures taken, etc... it's a nice addition! :)

Reviews.Title: A beauty, easy to handle
Reviews.Author: IRENA
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as local paper rated it as a good value.  I am not disappointed and it is indeed a good camera with clear pictures, easy to operate.  In future, would the seller mention it comes with a battery pak, as bought one separate and did not need it.

Reviews.Title: This is an excellent carry around camera.
Reviews.Author: Alfred F. Lee
Reviews.Content: I have bought two of these cameras the Lumix DMC-ZS10. When I bought the first one I was very disappointed in the quality of the video and still pictures they were over softened and looks smeary. However I went to the Panasonic website and downloaded the firmware update installed it in the camera and now the video and still photos are awesome. Whoever buys this should thoroughly read and understand the directions for using the camera and you'll find that for the money it's one of the best cameras on the market sincerely yours Alfred F Lee.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: nikoniko
Reviews.Content: best deal for the price point. this is my second lumix. only quirky thing is that it's easy to accidentally take photos if using the touch screen mode - not the worst thing really. otherwise, an awesome camera on all levels.

Reviews.Title: Easy use and always nice photo!
Reviews.Author: A Phillies' Fan "Phillies40"
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer but ZS10 always takes great and beautiful photos!  Almost everyone who sees me using this camera taking photos is amazed by the beauty of the picture.Update (04/12/2012): I broke this camera last week and I am bidding a used one in Ebay!  I love this one so much that I can not wait to get another!  :)Update (04/25/2012): I won the bid for a blue ZS10 in Ebay for $155 (plus a carry case and 8G Card, so I did not do too bad!  :)The camera still amazes me!  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: Dhuser
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my new camera.  It takes really clear shots, easy to operate, charged up the battery right out of box, ready to go in 2 hours after receiving.  Can't wait to test it out on vacation soon.  Amazon had the best price for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Broke after a month - GPS is Slow
Reviews.Author: redbrindlejake
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that the camera failed after just a month of use. It can no longer focus. I have to send it in for Warranty already. This just adds to the cost of the camera. And the hassle of owning it. Fortunately my old Nikon is around. I had to take it on the vacation I wanted the new camera for.  I am also disappointed in the GPS it is slow to acquire location. I was with my Brother in law that got the Nikon Coolpix AW100 the same day. we did side by side comparisons except for the Shorter zoom range I think i would go for the AW100. GPS was faster and has a map to verify location.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: David Page "David Page"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after seeing some negative reviews about its low light performance, and was genuinely impressed. This is my first camera that shoots in HD, and I am very happy with it. Although low light does suffer quite a bit in in intelligent auto mode, there are several decent low light modes, while not for subjects that are moving quickly, it does quite well for scenery and even portraits. The winning feature for me was the separate video recording button, allowing you to shoot video in most picture modes(panoramic and 3D excluded). The only feature that is annoying to me is the fact that it does not charge through the usb port, so if you leave it plugged into your computer to long the battery will drain. Overall a sharp little camera, with stunning outdoor video and adequate indoor video(providing you tinker with the settings).

Reviews.Title: A Step sideways
Reviews.Author: JackieTH
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the quality of pictures on my prior generation Lumix. So I waited a bit and grabbed this updated model when the price had come down. Yes it has a stronger zoom and a GPS antenna, but beyond that they've made a mess out of the menus, dumbed it down in terms of even less manual controls, and the overall picture quality may be slightly worse than its predecessor. Also has a touch screen feature which is a curiosity at best. At least it takes exactly the same battery. That's quite nice actually.

Reviews.Title: Very good all around but....
Reviews.Author: Chris Raab
Reviews.Content: If I weren't so picky about image quality I would give this camera five stars.  The camera is very easy to use and seems to do everything.  I found the touchscreen to be very good and usable, not quite iPhone but definitely easy to navigate.  The size of the camera seems perfect in my hands, not too small and but just the right size that it feels comfortable and secure in my hands.  The zoom is excellent as well as the wide angle length.Where I have a problem is with its image quality.  I'm not a professional photographer but I am a little picky about image noise.  I found the image noise to be unacceptable for a cameara that is marketed to above average photographers.  Images at ISO 100 is very good but above that level you can definitely see the difference.  With that said, if you want a camera that is very easy to use, has tons of features and takes better pictures than those cheaper digital point and shoot cameras then this camera may be for you.  But if you want a camera that takes pictures with more contrast and less noise I would look else where.  Priced around $200 is about right for this camera considering all the features you get.

Reviews.Title: Lots of settings, not a good manual to go with it.
Reviews.Author: KBallard
Reviews.Content: I find that the picture quality is awesome.  Due to so many setting options, I would have like a manual that offered detailed information.  The manual didn't really describe each setting and what it was used for.  Maybe this camera is for an advanced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: GJ
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great value. Paid 3x as much for the Leica version which is not as good. The biggest advandage to the Lieca is the sharp display. Not what I buy a camera for. I buy it for the quality of the shots.This is one nice camera. Just what I wanted to carry on motorcycle trips, where bulk is an issue. Same lens as on the Lieca version. Great metal body! I have been and still am a die hard Lieca fan. But this Panasonic is a great little camera!G.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use: BEAUTIFUL photos!
Reviews.Author: KPfeet
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I finally spent a little more so that my pictures live up to the quality of my memories!I really needed a good point and shoot after finally admitting that my pictures sucked.  With my old camera, the lighting was always off and I don't know enough about photography to manually adjust the settings.  I need something that is VERY user friendly that basically figures out for me what the right settings are.  This one does it!  I took it on a trip around NY and got POSTCARD QUALITY pictures by choosing some of the easy to understand automatic settings.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera (NOT) - Just a piece of worthless junk
Reviews.Author: hm
Reviews.Content: Updated Feedback - I've had the camera for over a year now when the lens auto focus mechanism quit working. It's won't close and just sticks out. Out of warranty and cost prohibitive to repair. Currently a non working piece of junk. If I can find another one on ebay for cheap I might try to repair it myself. My advice is don't waste your money on this camera -- the lens mechanical parts are not metal (plastic/nylon?) anyway it appears to be very cheaply made.Original Feedback - I ordered on Fri and received on Sat, played with it all weekend. This is an awesome camera! I shoot primarily manual and I found the features to be very robust. Everything from low-light macro, to night shots, to portraits, you name it ... and it does it. Although the manual and menu functions are well written and very intuitive, this is not a camera for the average consumer. It helps to know about aperture priority, iso settings, shutter speeds, white balance, etc. That's exactly the reason I bought it ... as a semi-pro, I want a point and shoot that I can tweek the exposure settings. Bottom line, this IS my travel camera, I love it!!!If you upgrade the firmware use this link. The one on Panasonic's website returns a ZS10_V12.bin that is the wrong size ... this link returns a self-extracting exe that creates a bin that is the correct size. This firmware update deletes your CS1, CS2, and CS2 settings and your MS1 and MS2 settings ... as well as all other settings, so be sure to write them down before doing the update (that is, if you want to keep them)v1.2 firmware update [...]

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS10
Reviews.Author: RS232
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, battery life average, but with GPS off acceptable, I would recommend purchasing a spare battery then you're on the safe side. Very fast shutter, great pic quality, good handling and size, not the cheapest but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: small and light
Reviews.Author: Heather Rolland "author"
Reviews.Content: I picked up the ZS-10 after murdering my FZ18 (shooting video in the hurricane - oops).  I was very happy with the FZ 18, but didn't want to spend the extra cash to replace it.  I was uncertain about the ZS, since I was so used to the larger lens and heavier camera.Most of the photography I do is on the hiking trail or in the woods.  I love to shoot using the macro feature, and don't take advantage of MOST of the other features.  This thing is crazy with all kinds of advanced and fancy settings and features (touch screen!  GPS!) but image quality is more important than any of those to me.  The ZS was pretty easy to use straight out of the box.  Controls and settings are where I expected them to be, no problems with getting set up and starting to shoot.I actually miss the heft and bulk of the larger camera, but that's just what I was used to.  The image quality appears to be the same.  The FZ was able to reshoot faster but not by much.  Both cameras have the same issue with extreme close ups and low light conditions - it can be frustrating to focus but there may be settings that will help with that problem.Battery seems to last a long time, and charged up for me in about 1.5 hours.Overall good, the jury is still out as to whether or not I can fall in love with this camera.  I still mourn for my fz 18.

Reviews.Title: Sophisticated camera
Reviews.Author: M. Magley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both shoot with DSLRs and are accustomed to having the ability to control how an image is taken (aperture or shutter priority, manual, etc).  I have had a Panasonic DMC-TZ3 for 4+ years and it is my "go to" camera when I don't want to lug out my "big" camera.  My husband wanted a similar one for his birthday so after exhaustive (and confusing) comparision research I once again bought a Panasonic because it has more control over image capture than other "point and shoot cameras", not to mention it has the incredible Leica superzoom lens.  My husband is still learning all the features but it is easy to use as a simple point and shoot, too.  It takes great pictures (no I have not pixel peeped).  I thought the GPS function would be superfluous but it is actually a nice feature to have.  I love the red - it makes a little camera like this easy to find (versus a black one). Both my husband and I are totally satisfied with this little guy.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, excellent zoom!
Reviews.Author: Judy S.
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that wasn't bulky and that has a good lens with great zoom capability without having to carry around an SLR.  I enjoy taking photos of the local wildlife around my house in Florida and was able to use the 16X zoom feature to see the eye of a Great Blue Heron very clearly! from a distance away.  Many little cameras now offer at 14 MP lens but in addition the 16x optical zoom on the Leica lens (same as for Nikon cameras I think) is an excellent quality.  Fairly easy to figure out how to use.  Though would be good to read through the long on-line manual to learn how to use all the features.  I prefer to turn the GPS feature off as I understand that may use up battery life more quickly, or keep that feature on stand-by mode.  I prefer to use the automatic settings and it interprets the scene (portrait, landscape, night) very well without my having to change settings.  There's a "no-shake" feature but when using the 16x zoom - you really need to keep the camera still as it feels like the scene is moving if not.  Overall, great camera - easy to carry - with longer zoom than most (for $100 less you get a good camera but only with an 8x optical zoom for example).  I got a good deal buying through Amazon - and was able to get the color of my choice (brown!).  I recommend this camera to people who want a beautifully sharp image.  Also, the camera was shipped and delivered within a few days.

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE MACHINE!!!
Reviews.Author: Samuel Barros "From the real south."
Reviews.Content: This wonderful camera can take beautiful pictures, including small flowerswith great detail. While taking pictures on the field, this camera was lostduring a trip to a small hill. It was impossible to find it the same daybecause it was getting dark. A friend find it the next day under the weeds.This camera suffered from low temperature and high humidity through the nightand early morning, and high temperature in the afternoon the next day.It was found about 5.00 pm in upright position and closed. I took off thebattery looking for the contacts and they were dry, so I put it back.With only some dust on the surface and lens cover, the rest of the camerasurface was OK. And... the camera is like new, and every function isworking. What else can I say? My LUMIX ZS10 is an INCREDIBLE MACHINE!!!!Samuel Barros.

Reviews.Title: Excellent zoom and fast operation
Reviews.Author: M. Dameron
Reviews.Content: Very impressive optical zoom. Startup time and shutter speeds nice and fast, nearly instant. Image quality is great and the videos are great too. All-in-all an impressive camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera
Reviews.Author: cjs
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a hunting trip to Africa.  All I can say is that I love it..  The picture quality is great, very few blurred photos (my Sony had a lot of blurred photos).  The zoom is outstanding.  The HD video is outstanding as well...  Video of archery shots at 30 fps, you would have 3 - 4 frames of the arrow in flight.Last, night shooting is exceptional at football games, etc..  when you figure out how to adjust to the correct scene settings.I would buy it again.Not that it is a downside, I turned off the GPS to save battery life.  I did not have an issue with battery life, but didn't want an issue either.Chris

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Victor Gavrilenko
Reviews.Content: This camera took better images than its predecessors ZS3 and ZS7 which I also owned. It has new features like geotagging with actual place name on the screen, 3D and HDR modes. It takes good 1080p video. Low light photos are not perfect, but better than predecessors. Too bad I dropped my ZS10 during bike ride and it died later.I bought LX5 to replace broken ZS10, but don't like form factor of LX5 and its menus. ZS10 has better design, better menus, better size, 1080p video and more features. But LX5 supposedly takes better pictures.

Reviews.Title: viedo and camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Pierce
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera.  Has a lot of settings, so it takes a while to learn exactly how to use it.  A lot of really neat settings. Pictures are exceptional.  I like the zoom best of all. Graduation class standing in bleachers--was able to zoom in on my grandson. I also zoomed in on a neighbors car (1/3 block away) and could read license plate. Wanted to know what kind of car it was, as I like it. A little expensive, but I had $150 for using Amazon Visa and a $75 Amazon gift card. If you are looking for a camera that gives you many options, this is the one for you. Also, I tend to shake sometimes and this has a stablizer that works well.

Reviews.Title: Beginner DSLR in a P&S;
Reviews.Author: Rose Alvarado
Reviews.Content: Definitely a very good camera for those photography beginners.  Takes wonderful HD Videos, took to the Bronx Zoo and the zoom was awesome and the pictures were amazing.  It has great manual settings, I'm just starting to get into those.  The touch screen is a nice feature haven't really used it too much and its not too sensitive in that if you accidentally touch it you go into 5 different options.  The battery life doesn't really last too long if you take a lot of HD Movies, but with pictures it fairs well.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS10 14MP Digital Camera with 16x Zoom
Reviews.Author: JEFF SMITH "Jeff Smith"
Reviews.Content: I had a DMC-TZ3 7MP with 10X Zoom, this is a better camera, a little thinner and takes better pictures, too.  Looking forward to taking a lot of great shot with the extra length in the Zoom lens and I bought larger SD memory to cover the need of 4 more pixels.GPS - don't know if I want people to know where I was at such and such a time.There are a few extra things this camera has that I will need to try before adding to this review.  Stay tuned for addition info...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: HUMBERTO ZAMORA
Reviews.Content: Purchased this point and shoot panasonic to replace my older point and shoot. It has great quality photos and so many photo schemes to choose from. Along with the gps you can take photos and shows where you where when you took the photo.

Reviews.Title: Dirt in lens
Reviews.Author: Blazing Tartan
Reviews.Content: This is my third TZ/ZS Lumix and as with the others, I've been more than happy with all aspects of the camera.  However, I keep my camera in my pocket all the time and this one has two specs of dust inside the lens which show up as fairly large shadows on lighter photos. This never happened with the previous cameras so I'm a bit miffed (to say the least) that it's happened with this one.  Other than that, it's a brilliant camera that consistently gives excellent results.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic zs-10
Reviews.Author: Tallisman
Reviews.Content: It,s a point & shoot camera that, in a very small form factor, hits a home run.  The optical zoom is 16x, which in such a small camera is non too shabby.  The HD video capability works very well.  And although it takes some time to get used to all of the menus, given it's myriad capabilities, it is time (and money) well spent.  It's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Even Better
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth camera I have had in this series. The others I have sold to my relatives and that allows me to rationalize an upgrade.  I expected that there would be the usual improvements in picture qualities, but was quite impressed with the improved ease of use considering all the new features added.  The on screen description of features selected work great as reminders.  The size is exactly same  as the earlier models and with the metal case is very rugged.  I shoot thousands of photos a year hiking and climbing, as well as other activities.  One of my climbing buddies impressed with my earlier ZS cameras purchased one as well instead of Brand "C".

Reviews.Title: Not worth the trouble...
Reviews.Author: Dive Addict "CD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in October 2011 as a spare camera when I didn't want to carry around my Nikon.  It's a good compact - just the right size for quick snapshots.Initially, I had no complaints.  I had shot a few pictures with it around the house, nothing too fancy, and it was good camera.  All told, less than 100 pictures before I took it on vacation in February.About 45 minutes into arriving, disaster.... Camera won't turn on.  OK.  Change the battery, right?  Wrong.  Still won't turn on.When I returned home, I sent it in for repair assuming it was still under warranty and that is where the problems started. As requested, I sent all the appropriate items (batteries, manuals, charger) including a copy of the receipt.Post two-weeks mailing it in, I get a phone call from Panasonic indicating they can't honor the warranty since I had not sent a copy of the receipt.  They want $180 to repair the camera.  Really?  But, that's ok - it probably got lost. No problem - I resent it via e-mail.A few days later, I get another phone call telling me that I had voided my warranty by not taking proper care of the camera.  Took about 10 minutes of discussion to find out what this "exactly" meant with me being told initially to go look this up in my owner's manual (which I sent back with the camera).  Finally, after going rounds, I was told the technician indicated the camera had got wet.All told, I had taken less than 100 photos with the camera.  And since it never went out of the house until my vacation (and it died within in the first 45 minutes of that), I'm still trying to figure out how it ever got wet.Obviously, it's my word against theirs and I am sure they get tons of cameras that get soaked and sent in with owners saying the same thing.  However, it was the run-around from them that completely soured the situation.  We had the loss of the initial paperwork, the demand for $$ for a repair, not being up front about their findings and finally, the manager telling me I should buy one of their camera's specifically made to get wet instead.  When I asked if this could be a design defect, I was told that was virtually impossible.So, I'm out a camera.  At least they sent it back and it will be fun to disassemble and see exactly how much corrosion is built up inside (apparently, it was ALOT).So my opinion is to avoid Panasonic at all costs.  I've had much better luck with many other brands out there and far less run-around trying to get them fixed.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Value at $179 - $200
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ralph J. Secoy
Reviews.Content: I do not understand other reviews saying that image quality is poor.  Per my experience with other Panasonic cameras, including a predecessor DMC-ZS7, the manual controls for aperture and others do not really perform as expected (or perform at all).  However, the "P" Program setting provides very good resolution, with photos that can be cropped to a surprising extent.  The Leica lens, CMOS sensor and Venus Engine seem to make a great difference in photo quality.  Clearance of this model for the next at $179 - 200 is an unbelievable value.  Purchased from Adorama Camera for $179.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Kenzmyth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as my walking-around-every-day-easy-to-carry camera. The ZS-10 is a great camera within it's limitations. I have used it for EBay products, shots of family and friends and video clips on the golf course, in the studio and in live theater situations. It captures decent audio, too. As a professional photographer and videographer, it goes on every photo shoot as a backup and B-roll video unit. It focuses quicker than any other point and shoot I have owned or tested and it's low light capability is quite good considering it's sensor size and unit cost.When my non-pro photographer friends and acquaintances ask for a recommendation, this is the camera I specify. I also like that it will fit in my shirt, jacket or even pants pocket and be ready toshoot in about 2 seconds. I owned and earlier version in this product line and continue to look at it's competitors to see if it can be topped, but am satisfied I have the right tool for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul V.
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my camera and camcorder.  I wanted a long zoom and 1080 video.  I've used it a lot and it performs great. Using the auto settings the pictures are great and it's extremely easy to switch back and forth between pictures and video.  The videos are great and fill and look good on my 47" flatscreen.  The only minor issue is that you have to remove the battery to charge it, but the charger is very small and easy to carry.  I don't use the GPS so battery life is good.  The software is usable and it's easy to upload to the PC. I am very happy with this camera and would recommend it to anyone who wants to take pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: A Perfect Little Travel Companion
Reviews.Author: Udo
Reviews.Content: I was very suprised to see all the great features of this High Tech camera. A great Leitz zoom lens and I wonder "how they managed to get this zoom in as little over one inch body width".  Lots  of settings for special shots. Good GPS, but the software should be updated to include more sites and special places, important for people who do a lot of travelling. A second battery is necesary and battery life is not all that bright.Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS10 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 16x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and Built-In GPS Function (Black)All together "great value" and I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Pics!
Reviews.Author: jennbmen
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace an old Canon.  I am very pleased with the picture quality.  There are numerous settings that can improve your pictures.  Lots of info and it is a "learn by doing" kind of gadget.  GPS is probably superfluous, but a fun perk.  Turn it off when you don't need it as it will eat up battery time!  I took some of the most beautiful sunset pictures and because of the high settings, I can blow them up and maintain picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, but GPS doesn't cut it.
Reviews.Author: Joel W. Goldwein "JWG417"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a digital camera with a GPS that "does the job", this is NOT the one to buy.  The GPS takes too long to acquire a position, and once acquired does not update frequently enough to use "on the go".  It also sucks battery life, so you'll want to have a spare battery on hand.That said, if you are looking for a great digital camera that takes good photos (quickly) and only occasionally need to geo-tag a picture, go for it.

Reviews.Title: Canon S95 VS Panasonic ZS10
Reviews.Author: Artur
Reviews.Content: I'm not pretending on anything and telling ahead of time I'm a pretty basic user. From all cameras on the market after a lot of purchases and returns I selected two - Canon S95 and this one. I'll upload couple images but overall I'm satisfied and will go with this camera. S95 has better night time pictures but it does not have any meaningful kind of zoom. Night pictures on this camera were not bad at all. Actually I disliked more indoor pictures that did not come out good. Zoom is good. Anti shake system worked pretty good for me and I do not have steady hands. But even at full zoom the pictures were pretty sharp.Do I completely like the dept' and quality of the picture - no I do not but I also did not completely liked it on S95.GPS for some reason did not work. I'll try it again but so far it did not...I really liked the speed it records pictures to the memory card. Compared to S95 it is night and day. S95 does it as a turtle.I'm posting some pictures so you will be able to take a look. As I said I'm a basic user so most pictures will be in automatic mode.

Reviews.Title: didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: rn "rn"
Reviews.Content: I tried this camera, the canon, & the nikon.  This camera had noticibly softer imgages than the other 3, and had a great deal more difficulty w/ the ambient room lighting.  All of it's photos were dark & would have required post procecessing on the indoor shots that I took w/o flash, even when I ramped up the ISO.  The other two handled it just fine.  I ended up chosing the canon for the image quality, even though it has the shortest zoom range of the 3, which is the feature I headed into this group looking at.

Reviews.Title: I really dislike this camera
Reviews.Author: R. Shaddy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had the best reviews for the price point I wanted to pay.  I had lost my husbands other point and shoot camera which took really great pictures so I wanted to replace it with something the same or better.  Since this camera received better reviews on Amazon than his last camera I bought this one.  OH was that a MISTAKE!  This camera is slow to take pictures.  I miss all the great shots because it takes so long to "think" about it.  Unless I have the setting on the fast multiple shot setting I miss everything.  However, on that setting the picture quality is terrible.On other settings the picture quality is also terrible.  I want my husbands other camera back. I'm getting rid of this one asap!

Reviews.Title: Takes really fuzzy pictures ...
Reviews.Author: Donald Gillies "secretbearer"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera if your girlfriend isn't very good looking, for example.  Otherwise, I'd look for a ZS7 or ZS3  I own both of these previous models ), or a Canon SX230 (the newest Canon improves on earlier generations and has surpassed the ZS10.)Please check out these studio shots, you can see the focus on the ZS10 is much poorer and the sharpness is much less than on earlier models (ZS7, ZS3) :(on double-yew, double-yew, double-yew dot imaging-resource dot com)Check out the colored yarn details (upper right corner) and then go to the Proportional Scale and see how many tick marks you can distinguish between 12 o'clock and 2 o'clock (ZS3 - 36, ZS7 - about 27, ZS10 - about 18!). The ZS3 ROCKS in these photos and the ZS7 is very good but the ZS10 is horrible !!There is one particular mode where you can set the "sharpening and image processing" in the ZS7, and if you turn it down all the way, I could not find a difference in performance between the ZS7 and ZS3, taking photos in low light in my family room about 2 months ago. Now that I've used both cameras (my wife owns the ZS7), I'd probably get a ZS7 the next time around just because the default point-and-shoot mode produces fewer yellow blotches, and it's more of a struggle to get good low-light pictures (must set 5 manual settings) on the ZS3.These cameras are loaded with features and I've used most of them at one time or another but frankly, many features is NEVER a substitute for clear and detailed pictures, especially at this price point !!!In my opinion, most buyers of the ZS10 would be much happier with either a ZS3, ZS7, or the new Canon SX230 (see studio shots 4th on the list above), as both of the older Lumixes and the newest Canon TravelZoom are much sharper than the ZS10.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Christopher Edgington "Edge"
Reviews.Content: I was initially disappointed with the results I was getting with the camera when I took a few snapshots of my friends. Changing the various modes on the camera didn't work and manually adjusting the settings fared no better. I was close to returning the camera when it was pointed out to me that the camera was taking good pictures...it was just that my friends were butt-ugly.  After trying the camera out on better looking individuals I can safely say that I'm happy with the results.GPS feature works well, too.

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Aunt Nota
Reviews.Content: This camera takes the best close up pics of any small camera I've ever owned. It's not hard to use but some of the settings are a bit confusing (especially for someone who is not tech oriented). I've learned a lot by trial and error and took some rather unitentional, interesting variations of the photos I intended to take. Movies are also wonderful but taking them eats battery life like crazy. The GPS feature is nice but it sometimes gets confused and doesn't update as it seems like it should (maybe due to my error?). All in all a great camera.

Reviews.Title: guala's bulky camera!
Reviews.Author: Laura G. D. Guzman "guala"
Reviews.Content: Been buying PANASONIC LUMIX cameras since 2005 or 2006, they've worked great for an all around basic camera, so I bought this for my mom (to replace her previous 2007 lumix version which was making super slow and making weird noises ),same brand, one that used the same memory and had the same type of commands she already knew form her previous camera.....The thing is, you'd think that as a model advances to a new one, everything should be improved!, not with this cam though, IT IS SUPER HEAVY AND BULKY! compared to many many out there, who, for the same price offer much more freedom of bulkyness!! the pictures are good, as LUMIX should be expected to, but my mom does not carry it around as much as she used to the past camera... you've guessed it,  because of the weight or it doesnt fit in her gowing-out-mini purses...next time i see this big of a discount on a camera.... ILL TRIPLE CHECK, OR I WONT BUY AGAIN!.. so disappointed....

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This camera has surprised me at the quality of pics and video that it takes. The wide angle zoom is great for a camera this size. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is b/c of battery life. I do leave the GPS feature on most of the time since I've been traveling so much which does drain the battery faster. Definitely get a back up battery.Overall wonderful camera for the price (I paid just under $200).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with Awesome Zoom but no Mac software
Reviews.Author: Theizzy
Reviews.Content: Great compact camera with a 16X optical zoom that extends up to 30X when using 7MP resolution!Good picture quality.Unfortunately it comes with PC software only so I could not extract AVCHD videos to my MacBook on the road.Also the the intelligent mode does not not allow you to change anything (exposure, white balance etc).

Reviews.Title: THE BEST LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: H. D. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I RESEARCHED TO FIND THE BEST TINY CAMERA WITH THE MOST ZOOM, GOOD MP'S AND SMALLEST SIZE.  AND IT IS TRULY THE BEST LITTLE CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED.  I FOUND IT IN RED OR BLUE AT AMAZON AND COSTCO HAD IT IN BLACK BUT FOR $50 MORE THAN AMAZON, SO I GOT THE BLUE MODEL FROM AMAZON. THERE IS NO DELAY WHEN YOU TAKE THE PICTURE LIKE I HAVE EXPERIENCED WITH PAST CAMERAS. THE BATTERY LASTS FOR HUNDREDS OF PICTURES (I STILL HAVEN'T CHARGED IT AND HAVE HAD IT FOR TWO MONTHS NOW TAKING PLENTY OF PICTURES. PICTURE QUALITY IS GREAT WITH THE 14 MEGAPIXELS. I DID DISCOVER WHEN READING INSTRUCTIONS THAT KEEPING THE CAMERA ON GPS MODE WILL RUN DOWN THE BATTERY EVEN WHEN TURNED OFF, SO I KEEP THE GPS OFF UNTIL I GO TRAVELING.  YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THIS CAMERA WHICH FITS IN YOUR SHIRT POCKET ! !

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera I have Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a really good, small, point and shoot camera that I could take some short HD video with. I'm not a photo pro, I just like to have a high quality, yet unobtrusive, camera available where ever I go. I have had the camera about 6 months now and I have been very happy with the image quality I get with this camera. I have only read several pages of the manual and have found the camera menus very intuitive to work with. Admittedly, I could probably get a lot more out of this camera if I took the time to RTFM.I was never happy with the way that my previous Olympus camera rendered blues. The Panasonic color balance, including blues, is as near perfect as I will ever need.Battery life is great!Get yourself a (medium) Tuff-Luv leather case for this digicam if you want a case that fits like a glove (with no space for anything else). A bit expensive but a great addition that is well worth the $.Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: B. Drakeford "Curious Traveler"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, yet you can drill down to settings like, food, or set it to auto intelligent, and forget it!

Reviews.Title: Could not ask for better.
Reviews.Author: Jerry M. Ku "newdad"
Reviews.Content: The pictures are just great, sharp, no blur with movement, the colors are very true, the zoom is fantastic. The battery doesn't drain as quickly as I thought it would with the gps always on. Easy to operate. The menu is very intuitive. Knowing that Leica and Panasonic worked on the technology makes me believe this will be a very good camera for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Nice  pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Gypsy
Reviews.Content: Little wider than some pocket cameras, but still fits pocket. Great pictures. Easy to use. I purchased 2nd battery just in case.

Reviews.Title: how to reduce noise?
Reviews.Author: J. Martin "JD"
Reviews.Content: Sorry for posting questions rather than observations. I want to buy this camera despite some of the negative comments as I think it has a lot of good features. But I will rarely use the full 14MP due to file size. If I shoot at say 10MP resolution, does the camera simply not use some pixels on the outer edges of the sensor, or does it throw away pixels throughout the image by resampling or some other method? Second question, one can easily add noise to an image but is there a way to remove noise that would work something like undoing the add noise filter? Conceptually it seems like noise should be as easily identifiable by algorithm as it is to our eyes. In which case wouldn't it be better shoot at full resolution and apply such filter when downsampling rather than shoot at lower resolution? If you are decreasing resolution anyway why not delete all the pixels tagged as noise first? You'd have the benefits of smaller files, better image quality, and better compressibility (noise doesn't compress).

Reviews.Title: awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I got this for a concert I went to and it took pretty good photos. I've always been a fan of Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Eh
Reviews.Author: Daniel James
Reviews.Content: To start, if you are getting this phone for it's touch screen capability, Don't. The touchscreen does not respond half the time and it is incredibly hard to use. When you take video the camera has a thing about ISO. It loves it. Which makes the video and low light pictures grainy. I would recommend a non touch screen version for children under 10. After 10 they can probably be trusted with a cheap DSLR. However if you are looking for a point and shoot to carry around... I still would not recommend it. There are much better point and shoot cameras made by panasonic for a better price.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoor use but REALLY BAD for indoor
Reviews.Author: Michael C Pooler
Reviews.Content: So I have had this camera for over 4 years and wanted to share my experience. This camera takes fantastic outside shots in bright sunlight. We have taken this camera all over the world from San Fransisco, the Mediterranean and the grand canyon and has allowed us to capture some great memories outside.That being said this camera has truly disappointed everywhere else. I can not take a picture in my house of my son without it being grainy and dark. My wife and I even took a class to make sure we were using the camera correctly. I also sent the product back to Panasonic to make sure that the camera was working correctly. This has truly been a bad purchase for me and my family. I am finally tired of sorting through a ton of bad pictures trying to find one good one of the 20 pictures we had to take on multiple setting with or without flash hoping that it will be good enough to print.Please do not waste your money and your experiences with this faulty product!

Reviews.Title: Good but not good enough.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: First, I am not new to digital cameras. Over the years I have had several digital pocket cameras from several camera makers.  I am always looking for a better camera.  I worked my way up to a high end DSLR but found that I missed having a compact carry it around camera.  One that would always be with me.Before I purchased the ZS10, I had the Panasonic ZS6.  Little did I know...  The ZS6 is a nice camera and easy to use.  So why then would I purchase the ZS10?  The ZS6 has limited zoom and no GPS.  I wanted more zoom power and the GPS.  Enter the ZS10.  GPS and 16X zoom.  Now we are talking.  But as I soon found out, the GPS on the ZS10 didn't work well.  Nothing like an automotive GPS.  When you change locations, say to a different count or state, you have to tell the ZS10 that you did so.  It becomes a pain and I found it difficult if not frustrating to do.  I do like the ZS10's 16X zoom.  It helps pull long distance shots in without using the digital zoom.  (Look it up)  Using digital zoom takes away image quality.  It plays with the pixels.  I will never use it.So far one out of two.  Good zoom but poor GPS.  Did I say that the pic quality of the ZS6 is better than that of the ZS10?  In most cases it is.  My wife, she was using the ZS6 and taking better pics than I was using the ZS10.  So for more than twice the price of the Panasonic ZS6 I got a so so camera. One other thing that is common to both cameras, the view finders are hard to see in bright sun lite.  I use a "Delkin Devices DU3.0 cover over the viewfinder.  This helps with glare and protects the from scratches and fingerprints.Bottom Line: I should have kept the ZS6 or waited for Panasonic to improve upon the ZS10.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Russ Delk
Reviews.Content: Used overseas and the GPS was great to have, worth every penny would use more if I didn't have a camera on my I phone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and great price!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Saavedra
Reviews.Content: I absolutely recommend this camera, is very good and the size is awesome! Is worth it for the price I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera like new to replace my old one
Reviews.Author: Bill in Colorado
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera for underwater photograpy with a housing I bought separately.  My ZS10 developed a spot on the pictures from some oil inside the camera.  Buying this like new model was less than repairing my old one, and it works great.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: The lens is crystal clear. Love this camera. HD feature in video is awesome, would highly recommend this product, Yes!

Reviews.Title: ZOOOOOOOM
Reviews.Author: A. M. Black "Andy B"
Reviews.Content: 16 times optical zoom combined with 14MP and a 24mm equiv wide angle makes this the most flexible camera I've ever owned.The touch screen is nice, but not necessary, and trying to use the camera on manual is overly complicated. The fact that you can trust the auto settings, shoot bursts, and record HD video make this an easy camera to own,Complaints? Only one - there is no explanation in the manual of the differences between the two image stabilization modes. Not a biggie.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Excellant Photo Quality.
Reviews.Author: stephen reynolds
Reviews.Content: This camera is ahead of its time and all others are playing catch up. Rugged quick set up and many options to shoot from. I wish it had internet capabilities but the new products do have that feature.

Reviews.Title: I really like all the features of this camera and have used ...
Reviews.Author: Sally in Colorado
Reviews.Content: I really like all the features of this camera and have used it for a year.  its pretty easy to use but I expected the pictures to be sharper.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: NG
Reviews.Content: While shooting pictures with low light, they come out fuzzy. Otherwise pictures and movies come out excellent and zoom is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Leica Lens and Features Galore ...You cant go Wrong!
Reviews.Author: jerry
Reviews.Content: Best Point and Shoot I have Owned...Have even dropped it into a Mountain Stream and with Time and Patience it dried out again and Works...come to think of it I have dropped it a few times ...best to buy a waterproof casing for it though!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Connie McVey
Reviews.Content: Love love love this camera.  It is slim, has a powerful zoom and takes wonderful pictures.  Just right for the amateur like me!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, poor packaging from new Amazon vendor
Reviews.Author: Teri M
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera and have had one for 2 years and been very happy with it.  I was recently on a vacation and lost it so when I returned home, went on Amazon and ordered the same one after reading the reviews of the new version which isn't as great as this one.  However, I ordered it from a new vendor on Amazon and it came in a plastic white shipping bag, hand written "Glass" which wasn't professional.  I got the impression that is was not new because the camera wasn't even in a plastic see thru bag like my previous one.  If someone had dropped the package, I don't think it would have survived.  Poor packaging, not sure it's brand new, and came without the card that can hold a few pictures.  My only complaint, obviously, is the vendor.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Allan Hawkins V
Reviews.Content: Well, after only 8 months using the camera, I finally got dust over de CCD. What are doing the people of Panasonic, playing with us? Fixed the problem!! Don't waste your money with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda L. Jones
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for every vacation and family pictures. It has great zoom quality and so many extras. It is easy to use and the 3 d effects is cool. We love this little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Luca
Reviews.Content: Panasonic are the best compact camera. Great photos, good menu, very long battery. You need 2 or 4 giga of memory for it

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera as a replacement to a very old Lumix (FZ5).  I got a great price through Amazon Warehouse and am really happy with the camera.  Its tiny, has a great zoom and takes very good photos for the price I paid.  The video clips are also very good and serves my purpose of short clips here and there.  The only thing I don't care for is the results using the IA mode.  I was very disappointed with the result and its a night and day difference when switching to the program or scene modes.  Overall, I think its a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera.
Reviews.Author: Eddie D Hinson
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and the 16x zoom brings things up close. Also the built in GPS is very handy disclosing your location and location of pictures taken. It is light weight and easy to take anywhere, but you must keep it in some kind of case when not taking pictures because dust can get inside of lens. If it had a viewfinder, it would almost be the perfect camera for the traveling person.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: G. Dowling
Reviews.Content: I had one before but abused it badly.Great in all fields except bouncability!I have the underwater housing too and get some good pictures for the price.

Reviews.Title: Greatest Zoom Ever
Reviews.Author: James Ray
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, but suspect that the 24X may be partly digital zoom rather than all optical. Just haven’t taken the time to analyze it. It’s such a fun camera to use, I don’t think I’ll ever utilize all the amazing features available on this super great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Siefker "Boiler Maker Bob"
Reviews.Content: We've been Canon users for years but I dropped our Canon pocket camera and killed it.My wife said "Let's get the kind of camera Peggy uses!"So we asked Peggy and she gave us the info on this camera.There are updated versions now, but we are tickled to death with this camera!I still have my Canon "hang around the neck" camera for more challenging shots, but I find I don't carry it as often if wife has this one along!

Reviews.Title: excellent photographic camera
Reviews.Author: Duarte Rios Guillermo Enri "Metalsilver"
Reviews.Content: This camera has almost everything for its price, is comfortable and has many options the pictures look great and I recommend it for purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: William L. Pepper
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. Picture quality, zoom, and ease of use is great. Buy it! You will not be dissappionted.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS10 - Handy and Powerful
Reviews.Author: Michael Monteleone
Reviews.Content: Lovely little camera for the pocket with great features and good quality pics and video - I wish the various menus were more intuitive but for the price it is a gem.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Roberto Matamoros "Roberto M"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use, long lasting battery, the optical zoom is great, nice camera! A little bigger than expected but a I love it.

Reviews.Title: Bought the same camera to replace lost one
Reviews.Author: James M. Ouellette
Reviews.Content: I liked the first one so much that I bought another to replace the one I had stolen or misplaced. It does exactly what I wanted it to do. 2 1/2 years and no problems to report.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: This is a great "all around" camera.  Takes excellent photos in all conditions.  Easy to operate.  Underwater case is available (extra cost).  Compact.  Tons of features.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Harriet H. Little
Reviews.Content: I adore my new Panasonic Lumix camera. After years of film cameras, I decided the time had arrived for me to try a digital camera. Wanting a compact, lightweight model, I bought my first Lumix in 2009 to use on a trip to Ireland. I fell in love not only with the digital process, but also the camera itself. I've  also taken the camera on two trips to Italy and just love its ease of use and the great photographs I've been able to take.Now, planning another trip, I realize that the many, many photographs I have taken must have made my beloved Lumix very "tired."Thus, I decided to buy a newer version to take along with my older one. My new Lumix had added features which I love, such as the 16x FullHD and the GPS. My real love of Panasonic cameras however, comes not just from their technical aspects but from the gorgeous photographs I am able to take. Many people have admired my photography, but I just tell them that good photography is made by also using a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: The camera really is fine, It just has much more on it than I need. I did not realize it had gps, video ect.. which is good if I could get into all that.

Reviews.Title: I love the camera
Reviews.Author: Ruthann
Reviews.Content: This camera has an awesome zoom you just can't beat.  Takes wonderful pictures.  Love the 10 picture mode when your taking pictures of a group.  GPS also included.You can take a picture by tapping the back lends of the camera.It also has  back touch screen.  Fits snug in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: lumix ZS10 camera
Reviews.Author: peter d banwell
Reviews.Content: I own an earlier model Lumix digital camera and this one does everything it does; many are easier to do.

Reviews.Title: Works as intended, complete, and looks & works like new
Reviews.Author: Wesley D. Coleman
Reviews.Content: Only had it a day, but the first photo taken indoors reported connecting with 4 GPS satellites and gave a very accurate location in geotagging my photo as I require.

Reviews.Title: My third generation of the Lumix; one of three in this purchase.
Reviews.Author: DannySea
Reviews.Content: One of the best for wide angle (24 MM). And a great zoom! (x16). Can do video. This generation is faster recovery, great for room and elevation pix, and a better placement of dial control, and on and off location. Easy to change flash to the needs of the moment.One added item they no longer send is the soft-sided carry pouch.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James Weiss
Reviews.Content: The camera is a great value for the price.  I am not good with all the modern equipment they have out today, but found this camera easy to use.

Reviews.Title: incredibly fine camera
Reviews.Author: Martha Luehrmann
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It has a 16X optical zoom which is corrected for jitter (very important when you are using high magnification). It has excellent resolution and excellent color sensing. My iPhone has a decent camera, but this Lumix is indispensable.

Reviews.Title: Love it..
Reviews.Author: M. Schlichting
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and the zoom is amazing...Took it on my trip to the East Coast and I got some fabulous pictures...

Reviews.Title: Easy to use Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Stone Miller
Reviews.Content: Having lost my first one like this by not attaching it to my arm when on a boat sailing down a river and then managing to lose my bag in which I had its replacment, this was my third one. Needless to say, I love it and it is wonderful. It has many scene view apps with which to work when taking a picture. It even has another 12 up above the original 18. It is so handy I can put it in my purse or pocket and takes wonderful pictures. Be sure to get this model. I thought I'd replaced the first one with something that was an update  but wasn't. It didn't begin to compare with all that is on this particular model.

Reviews.Title: Unnecessary features make it more costly
Reviews.Author: mcs1505
Reviews.Content: I had an old version of this camera which I loved, but I lost it and needed to replace it.  In steps the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS10.Pros, aside from zoom and megapixels:- Some of the most frequently accessed menu items come up if you merely turn the display option on, so you don't have to hunt for them.- Switching to video is as simple as pressing a button on the top (but an indented button, so you won't accidentally trigger it)- I've always liked Panasonic's stand alone battery chargers so I don't have to lug around several AA or AAA batteries, which is a plus when traveling.Cons- It almost feels too light, like the casing will crack if I set it down too hard.- There's no way to completely turn off the touch screen features so I would be taking a picture and brush against the screen and it would change the focus or little boxes would show up on the screen, blocking part of the shot.- In all but one setting on the camera, there is no quick and easy way to prevent overzooming (leaving the optical zoom for digital zoom) so you have to be extra vigilant if you want to use maximum optical zoom but still retain the quality of your picture.Overall: do not buy this camera if you aren't going to use the touchscreen because it will get in the way and be a dealbreaker.All in all I wasn't satisfied and returned this camera.  I purchase a ZS-8 and am much happier with it

Reviews.Title: It does too much
Reviews.Author: Tiny Tim "Tiny Tim"
Reviews.Content: The vendor sent the product PDQ.  This is NOT a point and shoot camera.  I found the Automatic mode doesn't take clear pictures indoors or out even though I'm shooting at 3MB.  I have lot of trouble shooting photos at night in Auto mode.  There are a zillion settings and it takes forever to find the right one.  Next time I'm buying a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera--but takes  "big" pictures
Reviews.Author: D. Hummel
Reviews.Content: Performs like more expensive cameras. Wish I had purchased it long ago. One gets a lot of "bang for the buck in this little gem

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera.
Reviews.Author: Dene Masengill
Reviews.Content: This is the third generation of this model for me.  I carry it on my horse when I am foxhunting around my neck.  I love the quality of the pictures and the ease of operation with gloves on. Just a great little camera  for my needs

Reviews.Title: It is a good product, but...
Reviews.Author: Renato Correa Filho
Reviews.Content: As I've said, it is nice if you want a compact camera with many features.I am not a photographer and I don't like to set the camera every time. What I realy need is a good automatic mode and this camera take darks and shaked photos in low light conditions.Record films with it is not as good as I expected because automatic focus doesn't work satisphactory.

Reviews.Title: Almost, but not quite ...
Reviews.Author: alene
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera.  We have four other Panasonics and we love every one of them.  This was supposed to be my "Disney" camera (one I could take places where photography would not be the first thing on the agenda, but still would want to have a camera with me at all times).  It had everything I wanted.  Long telephoto reach, the ability to choose aperture or shutter preferred operation, and startlingly beautiful blue color to set it apart from the rest.When it came I loved everything about it except it kept taking pictures all by itself.  I did know before I ordered it that it had a touch screen, but I assumed that that 'feature' could be turned off.  If it can, I wasn't able to find the "off" button.  I searched the menus.  I read everything I could find about it here and on other sites.  Several people mentioned being annoyed by the fact that accidentally touching the screen either took a picture or moved the focus point, but no one that I found mentioned not being able to disable it altogether.The few pictures I did take with it (intentionally) came out perfectly.  (In fact a couple of the "camera's choice -- unintentional" pictures even came out perfectly exposed and focused!)  So, I'm reluctantly giving the product a three since it took good pictures, but I returned the camera because I knew that the touch screen issue would drive me nuts.  Otherwise, I'd have given it a five.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: don carroll
Reviews.Content: I've had a chance to use the camera and since I have an earlier model I found it easy to use. really like the extra focus with the zoom action.

Reviews.Title: Buena para las fotos, floja para el video...
Reviews.Author: marco morales "bochas"
Reviews.Content: En lineas generales esta camara saca fotos muy buenas...aprovecha la luz bastante bien en el dia y las fotos que se toman son de gran calidad.....buena relacion calidad/precio...el punto en contra es el modo grabacion de video; no me gusto y me parecio floja; a diferencia del modo foto, esta funcion de video no aprovecha la luz y el video es de regular calidad....otro punto en contra es el software; deberia ser mas facil de manejar en la PC o laptop y no ser tan poco amigable.

Reviews.Title: COOL
Reviews.Author: engelly
Reviews.Content: NICE SERVICE, NICE ITEM, ALL GOOD AND RECOMENDABLE!!THEY SHIPPED BEFORE THE DEADLINE AS I ASK CUZ I WAS IN A RUSH.

Reviews.Title: In Focus
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Nixon
Reviews.Content: I love the camera so far.  Only used it a few times.  I love the zoom and especially the wide angle feature.  The price was good also.

Reviews.Title: Love my Lumix
Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: It is by far the best camera in a small compact.  Reasonable price.  Wonderful warranty.  The Pictures are clear.  I use nothing but Lumix and Amazon's price was the best.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Melissa B. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the quality of the prints and the are very useful i am still trying to figure all of them out though but I love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas gift and I absoutely love it.  I've taken a few pictures and they have turned out great.  I still have to learn how to use the GPS function, but am really looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: Got replaced by ZS20 after I went swimming with it in the pool
Reviews.Author: JanA "Jaugi"
Reviews.Content: Well, this Camara is not water proofed, I tested it :)The ZS10 is a very good Camera though. We didn't plan to upgrade it with the ZS20.The ZS10 has a very good zoom and the usage is easy. We love the GPS that tells us where the photo was made.If you don't use it for a long time or you travel a long distance it will take a while to find the satellites and it of course does not work in bunkers ;)However, the ZS20 is a step forward in terms of high iso pictures and has an even better lens with now 20x zoom.If you want to save some money the ZS10 is still a good choice though.I loved this Camera and think the panasonic lumix series are the best point and shoot Cameras I know. If you have little more money go on the ZS20 though.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara a u precio increible.
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Maspero "emaspero"
Reviews.Content: Funciona perfecto. Tiene un zoom increible. El GPS anda muy bien y toma satelites bastante rapido. Fotos increibles. La funcion de video es muy buena y se activa con SOLO un boton, nada mas.  Se pueden sacar fotos mientras se esta filmando.Excelente.

Reviews.Title: 5th version of this camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Cadillacrazy "cadillacrazy"
Reviews.Content: Love it this last time ordered it and the canon equivalent. Chose this one because it's slightly better. wider wide and better menus

Reviews.Title: The great product
Reviews.Author: Edson
Reviews.Content: Delevery is very fast, fair price, this prodcut is very usefull and exceed my expectations with quality with quality and safe.

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: This camera has replaced the SLR for most of our photographic needs.  Great zoom, light weight, com[pact size, well built,

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Zucchini
Reviews.Content: After a couple years of borrowing the in-laws Lumix, we broke down and got our own and love it. Great for outdoor shots and well lit product shots (like Etsy + Ebay + web) that we use for our small business.
